subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Readiness Indicators for Scale
description: A 60-second lesson on Readiness Indicators for Scale.

hook.text: A founder asks their advisor: 'How do I know when it's time to scale?' The answer isn't a feelingâ€”it's data.

buildup.text: Key readiness signals: repeatable sales process, positive unit economics, and a retention curve that flattens.

discovery.text: If your customer acquisition cost recovers within 12 months and retention holds, the math works at scale.

twist.text: But numbers alone aren't enough. You also need systems that won't collapse under 10x the volume.

climax.text: Slack waited until 8,000 teams used the product daily before opening signups to the public.

punchline.text: Scale when the engine works, not when investors clap.

quiz.question: Which is a reliable readiness signal for scaling a startup?
options: Positive press coverage from major outlets
Repeatable sales process with positive unit economics
